What is the significance of main-group metals in the design of high-performance gas sorption materials?
data.answer: Despite the statistical favoring of transition-metal MOFs, the magnesium form of MOF-74 exhibits the highest CO2 uptake capacity, highlighting the unique significance of main-group metals.

data.question: Are CPM-200 MOFs capable of adsorbing N2 at 273 K?
What is the role of the charge-to-radius ratio of metal ions in MOFs?
data.answer: The charge-to-radius ratio of metal ions in MOFs is related to the role of open metal sites on gas sorption properties, with a strong correlation observed between this ratio and the isosteric heat for CO2.

What is the effect of the cooperative crystallization strategy on the crystallization of CPM-200 MOFs?
data.answer: The synergy during crystallization of CPM-200 is so essential that corresponding homometallic MOFs could not be made under the same conditions in the absence of any one of two metal sources.

data.question: Can the synthesis conditions for heterometallic CPM-200 MOFs be easily replicated for homometallic MOFs?

data.answer: To achieve matching kinetics for chemically dissimilar metal ions, the types of metal precursors, as well as types of and ratios between solvents and cosolvents, were focused on.
